result.execSummary:
The defendant RICHARD C CONN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent.  2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at time of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808 Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.
  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  *** DUE TO COVID-19 PANDEMIC CALL 920-236-4906 BEFORE REPORTING TO THE COURTHOUSE.  HAVE YOUR COURT PAPERWORK IN HAND WHEN YOU MAKE THE CALL.  STAFF WILL GIVE YOU FURTHER DIRECTIONS.***Immediately following court, please report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

records.addlTxt: Defendant RICHARD C CONN in court with attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug.  Defendant RICHARD C CONN in custody.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RICHARD C CONN appeared by video means with Attorney. Victim rights complied with. Defendant waives in person appearance.  Oral arguments.

RICHARD C CONN appeared by video means with Attorney. Victim rights complied with.  Motion in Limine and Jury Instructions. Bond continues. Defendant RICHARD C CONN in court with attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading.  Defendant would like to speak to court against counsels advice.  Court reviews complaint and finds probable cause.   Defendant requesting speedy trial.  Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
